title: MySQLISNULL()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLISNULL()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Test whether an expression is NULL:
SELECT ISNULL(NULL);

Definition and Usage
The ISNULL() function returns 1 or 0 depending on whether an expression is NULL.
If expression is NULL, this function returns 1. Otherwise, it returns 0.
Syntax
ISNULL(
expression
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
expression
Required. The value to test
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Test whether an expression is NULL:
SELECT ISNULL("");

Example
Test whether an expression is NULL:
SELECT ISNULL(350);

Example
Test whether an expression is NULL:
SELECT ISNULL("Hello world!");

★
+1

The correct definition of Function

quiz.question: What is If expression?
options:
NULL:
SELECT ISNULL(NULL);

Definition and Usage

quiz.explanation: The correct definition of If expression is 'NULL'.

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLISNULL()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLISNULL()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQLISNULL()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
